intro: Dinochloa tjankorreh, commonly known as the Tibetan spikerush, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and is characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming dense spikes that are often surrounded by bracts. Dinochloa tjankorreh plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
